title: National Struggle Party
text:
The National Struggle Party (<a href="Turkish%20language">Turkish</a>: "Milli Mücadele Partisi," abbreviated MMP) is a <a href="Nationalism">Nationalist</a> political party in <a href="Turkey">Turkey</a>. It was formed by <a href="Ahmet%20Kaya%20%28politician%29">Ahmet Kaya</a>, whose Turkish nationalism has been contrasted with the <a href="Kurdish%20people">Kurdish</a> nationalist <a href="Ahmet%20Kaya">singer</a> of the same name. The MMP's founders claim that it is neither a rival nor an enemy of any other established party, even though its ideology is close to the <a href="Nationalist%20Movement%20Party">Nationalist Movement Party</a> (MHP). The pro-<a href="Justice%20and%20Development%20Party%20%28Turkey%29">Justice and Development Party</a> (AKP) newspaper "<a href="Yeni%20Akit">Yeni Akit</a>" accused the party of being founded by supporters of <a href="Fethullah%20G%C3%BClen">Fethullah Gülen</a> after failing to gain influence within the MHP. However, the party also advocates <a href="Kemalism">Kemalism</a>, which is in contrast with the <a href="Islamist">Islamist</a> political agenda of Gülen.
The party currently has no <a href="Member%20of%20Parliament">representation</a> in the <a href="Grand%20National%20Assembly">Grand National Assembly</a> and is yet to contest any elections.
